titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dickason Papers, 1866-2012 MSS.172
titlestmt.author: David Brown in 2010 with additional notes written by Andrea Kutsenkow in 2016.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-10 09:42:49 -0500.

change.item: Record edited by Andrea Kutsenkow to reflect 2016 accretion

did.abstract: This collection is comprised of materials documenting Jerry G. Dickason's and Elly Dickason's affiliation with the Judson Memorial Church and its associated organizations, including materials related to the production of the book Remembering Judson House, which was published in 2000. These materials date between 1920 and 2012 and include correspondence, manuscripts, research notes, research materials, galley proofs, board minutes, photographs, newspaper clippings, transcripts of sermons, church bulletins, artwork, and media.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of materials documenting Jerry G. Dickason's and Elly Dickason's affiliation with the Judson Memorial Church and its associated organizations, including materials related to the production of the book Remembering Judson House, which was published in 2000. These materials date between 1920 and 2012 and include correspondence, manuscripts, research notes, research materials, galley proofs, board minutes, photographs, newspaper clippings, transcripts of sermons, church bulletins, artwork, and media.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Dickason Papers; MSS 172; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jerry G. Dickason, a retired professor, and Elly Dickason, a long-time member of the Judson Church congregation, edited the book Remembering Judson House (Judson Memorial Church, 2000), a compilation of 48 interviews with people who lived or worked at Judson House.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into five series: Series I: Production Materials; Series II: Source Materials and Research; Series III: Administrative Materials Unrelated to "Remembering Judson House;" Series IV: Hot Spots Calendar (includes Production Materials), and Series V: 2016 Accretion.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Dickason Papers were initially donated to NYU in 2002. Accretions followed in 2007 and 2013. A third accretion was donated by Jerry G. Dickason in April 2016; the accession number associated with this gift is 2016.051.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions about the arrangement, description, and physical interventions taken on this collection prior to 2016 have not yet been recorded. In December 2016, an accretion was incorporated into the collection as a separate series. Some materials were treated for mold and then rehoused in acid-free folders and an archival manuscript box. Materials were kept in the order in which they were received from the donor, and interleaving and Mylar sleeves were used for acidic newsprint and loose photographs.
On February 2019, materials from accession 2008.172 were placed in new acid-free folders and manuscript boxes, rehoused for offsite storage. Original order of documents maintained from boxes 20-23.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Audiovisual and born-digital materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Box 5 consists of moving image and audio; box 5a consists of computer disks. These items are originals: no access copies currently exist for resarcher use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This accretion has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are arranged in the order in which they were received by the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The accretion consists of materials that date between 1969 and 2012 with the bulk of the materials dating between the early 1970s and the early 1990s. Within the accretion are transcripts of sermons (including one by Elly Dickason), Judson Memorial Church bulletins, photographs used in Remembering Judson House, as well as memorial materials about the passings of composer Al Carmines and Minister Howard R. Moody. Also included in the accretion are materials about Dickason's and former Judson employee Jim Covington's involvement with the New York Center for Men (1983-1984), as well as a file about the research of anti-war activist Maarten Knottenbelt (1982-1989).

did.unittitle: The New York Center for Men
